snippet.textDisplay: I remember being 10 yrs old and had no idea how to fix this area. Because i didn't speak english i had to call that nintendo service line, and they gave me wrong answers. At that time i was at my grandparents, when my mother came to pick me up and i explained something about this game, she asked me why i didn't try something which i was like no that doesn't work. So ok, i give it a try and yes that was how to solve the puzzle. She never played any videogame and i was like !!!??.??
snippet.textOriginal: I remember being 10 yrs old and had no idea how to fix this area. Because i didn't speak english i had to call that nintendo service line, and they gave me wrong answers. snippet.textDisplay: I haven't played through seasons (because I'm currently in the middle of The Minish Cap), but from what I've heard, Seasons seems to be the more popular choice. I can't really say which one is better, but you might prefer Seasons.
snippet.textOriginal: I haven't played through seasons (because I'm currently in the middle of The Minish Cap), but from what I've heard, Seasons seems to be the more popular choice. I can't really say which one is better, but you might prefer Seasons.

snippet.textDisplay: Where are people getting this misinformation about Ages having a larger amount of puzzles than Seasons? Ages focuses more on puzzles in dungeons while Seasons focuses more on puzzles in the world. Ages only really has slightly more puzzles than Seasons but not enough to make a huge difference.
snippet.textOriginal: Where are people getting this misinformation about Ages having a larger amount of puzzles than Seasons? Ages focuses more on puzzles in dungeons while Seasons focuses more on puzzles in the world. Ages only really has slightly more puzzles than Seasons but not enough to make a huge difference.

snippet.textDisplay: These two games and especially their music remind me on a time that i have already forgotten. Not only on my childhood, when i plaid them, but rather on the ancient times, when europe was still much more like the world in these games. I cannot wait anymore for the return of this age, but i now it will return, because time is a circle and everything will reapeat itself. The future is the past.

snippet.textDisplay:
When it comes to music tracks, I preferred the ones exclusive to this game over the ones exclusive to Oracle of Ages. 

I think the Subrosians are cooler than the Tokay, the Subrosian Dance is better & easier than that pain in the ass Goron Dance, but I think Veran is slightly cooler than General Onox. 

When I play the 2 side-by-side, I mostly do Oracle of Ages 1st & this 1 (password) 2nd. 

I just prefer to do it like that, don't ask me why.
snippet.textOriginal:
When it comes to music tracks, I preferred the ones exclusive to this game over the ones exclusive to Oracle of Ages. 

I think the Subrosians are cooler than the Tokay, the Subrosian Dance is better & easier than that pain in the ass Goron Dance, but I think Veran is slightly cooler than General Onox. 

When I play the 2 side-by-side, I mostly do Oracle of Ages 1st & this 1 (password) 2nd. 

I just prefer to do it like that, don't ask me why.

snippet.textDisplay: I love Oracle of Seasons, and it has a lot of things going for it (I agree Holodrum is better then Labrynna by miles), but let's not say Onox is better then Veran.  Onox just sits there waiting for you to show up.  Veran spends most of the game fucking Link's shit up, even when he finally thinks he has one over on her, only to find out she has a back up plan.  I think OoS has a better overworld, and OoA has better dungeons.
snippet.textOriginal: I love Oracle of Seasons, and it has a lot of things going for it (I agree Holodrum is better then Labrynna by miles), but let's not say Onox is better then Veran.  Onox just sits there waiting for you to show up.  Veran spends most of the game fucking Link's shit up, even when he finally thinks he has one over on her, only to find out she has a back up plan.  I think OoS has a better overworld, and OoA has better dungeons.

snippet.textDisplay: Never got OOA? Lo, a shame. I'd recommend finding a way to play both. OOS is a great game, but what really sets the Oracles apart from the rest of Zelda is the way the two stories in two different countries interact with each other and with Hyrule. It's strange. The very thing that makes me think they deserve a squeal is probably the same thing that's kept them from making it.
snippet.textOriginal: Never got OOA? Lo, a shame. I'd recommend finding a way to play both. OOS is a great game, but what really sets the Oracles apart from the rest of Zelda is the way the two stories in two different countries interact with each other and with Hyrule. It's strange. The very thing that makes me think they deserve a squeal is probably the same thing that's kept them from making it.

snippet.textDisplay: Well, have you played "Four Swords Adventures?" Twas like a 16 bit game but on the 100+ bit Gamecube instead of the SNES or GBA. The great graphics gap allowed the game to do things most can't, primarily relating to large numbers of individual moving objects sharing the screen & flowing animation. If an 8 bit Secrets were on the WiiU, the gap would be 8 to 6/700+. Even on the 3DS this game could be enormous. A big problem is that the Oracles were the lowest selling Zelda games, or so I've heard.
snippet.textOriginal: Well, have you played "Four Swords Adventures?" Twas like a 16 bit game but on the 100+ bit Gamecube instead of the SNES or GBA. The great graphics gap allowed the game to do things most can't, primarily relating to large numbers of individual moving objects sharing the screen & flowing animation. If an 8 bit Secrets were on the WiiU, the gap would be 8 to 6/700+. Even on the 3DS this game could be enormous. A big problem is that the Oracles were the lowest selling Zelda games, or so I've heard.

snippet.textDisplay: this was my first zelda game, i bought it in like 2nd grade. it was really hard for me to figure out how to get out of the first part....anyways, this game is my favorite zelda game. i think every zelda fans favorite one is their first because it triggers so many memories. kojis music is also composed so intricately. he knows which arpeggios and notes are going to hit your emotions and make you feel the exact way he wants you to feel.
snippet.textOriginal: this was my first zelda game, i bought it in like 2nd grade. it was really hard for me to figure out how to get out of the first part....anyways, this game is my favorite zelda game. i think every zelda fans favorite one is their first because it triggers so many memories. kojis music is also composed so intricately. he knows which arpeggios and notes are going to hit your emotions and make you feel the exact way he wants you to feel.

snippet.textDisplay:
If I was to do a Top 10 list of all the music tracks that can only be heard in Seasons (not Ages or Link's Awakening), there would definitely be a spot for this 1 as well as....

-Subrosia
-Subrosia Home & Market
-Date with Rosa
-Level 1: Gnarled Root Dungeon
-Level 2: Snake's Remains
-Level 4: Dancing Dragon Dungeon
-Level 7: Explorer's Crypt
-Temple of Seasons Ruins
-Sunken City

snippet.textDisplay: Both Ages and Seasons share some music traks. Only Ages has deeper music than Seasons, but the puzzles are brutal. The Power Glove tile puzzle really ticked me off.
snippet.textOriginal: Both Ages and Seasons share some music traks. Only Ages has deeper music than Seasons, but the puzzles are brutal. The Power Glove tile puzzle really ticked me off.

snippet.textDisplay: the gameboy color Zelda games (the 3 of them) are my favorite zelda games. MUCH better than Lttp, which is VERY overrated.
snippet.textOriginal: the gameboy color Zelda games (the 3 of them) are my favorite zelda games. MUCH better than Lttp, which is VERY overrated.

snippet.textDisplay:
Zelda: Oracle of Seasons and Ages are severely underrated. It has a fresh and new start that both returns to the original Zelda roots while it explores new opportunities in 2-Dimensional gameplay. And of course, a beatiful soundtrack that uses the small Gameboy Colour for all it's worth. 

The reason why I don't like Minish Cap and Phantom Hourglass is because I liked these two far more...
snippet.textOriginal:

The reason why I don't like Minish Cap and Phantom Hourglass is because I liked these two far more...
